programme.desc: A young killer experiences intense pleasure whenever she hears the sound of human pain.

programme.title: The Guard
programme.desc: A vulgar Irish cop (Brendan Gleeson) and a straight-laced American FBI agent (Don Cheadle) uncover police corruption among the former's superiors while probing a drug-trafficking ring.

programme.title: The Last Tree
programme.desc: After growing up in quiet, rural Lincolnshire, teenager Femi struggles with unfamiliar surroundings and cultural differences when he moves in with his mother in London.

programme.title: Queen Collective 2020
programme.desc: Young Black freedom fighters and their educators are the first folks in the country to change the name of a park from a slaveholder to abolitionists Anna and Frederick Douglass in Chicago's North Lawndale neighborhood.

programme.title: Kevin Garnett: Anything Is Possible
programme.desc: Chronicling the career of one of the NBA's all-time greats, featuring scenes from Garnett's induction into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame.

programme.title: The Last Black Man in San Francisco
programme.desc: Jimmie and his best friend Mont try to reclaim the house built by Jimmie's grandfather, launching them on a poignant odyssey that connects them to their past, even as it tests their friendship and sense of belonging in the place they call home.

programme.title: Déjà Vu
programme.desc: The team of top-secret program brings ATF agent Doug Carlin (Denzel Washington) into its midst to capture the terrorist (Jim Caviezel) responsible for a ferry bombing that left hundreds dead. Its amazing technology lets the team fold time four days backward and see the madman's movements as he plots to kill a woman who could give him away. Doug realizes that the technology could allow him to do what law-enforcement officers dream of -- go back in time to prevent the crime.

programme.title: The Hurt Locker
programme.desc: Staff Sgt. William James (Jeremy Renner), Sgt. J.T. Sanborn (Anthony Mackie) and Specialist Owen Eldridge (Brian Geraghty) are members of a bomb-disposal unit in Baghdad. As their tour of duty enters its final weeks, the men face a set of increasingly hazardous situations, any of which could end their lives in an explosive instant.

programme.title: Fruitvale Station
programme.desc: Though he once spent time in San Quentin, 22-year-old black man Oscar Grant (Michael B. Jordan) is now trying hard to live a clean life and support his girlfriend (Melonie Diaz) and young daughter (Ariana Neal). Flashbacks reveal the last day in Oscar's life, in which he accompanied his family and friends to San Francisco to watch fireworks on New Year's Eve, and, on the way back home, became swept up in an altercation with police that ended in tragedy. Based on a true story.

programme.title: The Last Black Man in San Francisco
programme.desc: Jimmie and his best friend Mont try to reclaim the house built by Jimmie's grandfather, launching them on a poignant odyssey that connects them to their past, even as it tests their friendship and sense of belonging in the place they call home.

programme.title: Lee Daniels' The Butler
programme.desc: After leaving the South as a young man and finding employment at an elite hotel in Washington, D.C., Cecil Gaines (Forest Whitaker) gets the opportunity of a lifetime when he is hired as a butler at the White House. Over the course of three decades, Cecil has a front-row seat to history and the inner workings of the Oval Office. However, his commitment to his "First Family" leads to tension at home, alienating his wife (Oprah Winfrey) and causing conflict with his anti-establishment son.

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: In a Mexico City wracked by a recent wave of kidnappings, ex-CIA operative John Creasy (Denzel Washington) reluctantly accepts a job as a bodyguard for 9-year-old Lupita (Dakota Fanning), the daughter of wealthy businessman Samuel Ramos (Marc Anthony). Just as Creasy begins to develop a fondness for the young girl, a bloodthirsty gunman (Jesús Ochoa) kidnaps her. Now, Creasy must pick off a succession of corrupt cops and criminals to reach his ultimate object of vengeance.

programme.title: Scary Movie
programme.desc: Defying the very notion of good taste, Scary Movie out-parodies the pop culture parodies with a no-holds barred assault on the most popular images and talked-about moments from recent films, television and commercials. The film boldly fires barbs at the classic scenes from "Scream," "The Sixth Sense," "The Matrix," "I Know What You Did Last Summer" and "The Blair Witch Project," then goes on to mock a whole myriad of teen movie clichés, no matter the genre.

programme.title: Yellowjackets
programme.desc: As starvation looms, Taissa leads a last-ditch effort; amid felony schemes and all-night stakeouts, the Yellowjackets are forced to partake in small talk (New!).

programme.title: VICE
programme.sub-title: But I Read It Online & No Safe Haven
programme.desc: Alzo Slade investigates medical disinformation under the guise of alternative health during the COVID-19 pandemic; Hind Hassan travels to the frontiers of Turkey and Europe to document a new migrant crisis and abuses of international law (New!).

programme.title: Aquarium of the Dead
programme.desc: Sea creatures in an aquarium become zombies after a scientific accident.

programme.title: RINGSIDE
programme.desc: Filmmaker André Hörmann follows the professional and private lives of two young boxers for eight years.

programme.title: Why Did I Get Married?
programme.desc: Eight married friends take their annual reunion vacation in the Colorado mountains. Revelations of infidelity involving one pair shatter the amicable mood, forcing the remaining friends to take a hard look at the strength of their own marriages. The couples grapple with issues of commitment, love, betrayal and forgiveness as they try to move on with their lives.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Attempting to win the favor of the newly divorced Suzanne (Nia Long), Nick (Ice Cube) offers to accompany her children, Lindsey (Aleisha Allen) and Kevin (Philip Bolden), on a flight from Portland, Ore., to Canada to see their mother. A mishap with a corkscrew and a metal detector gets the troupe banned from the flight, however, so Nick is forced to drive the kids in his prized Lincoln Navigator. Tensions inevitably rise during the long road trip, but Nick is not to be deterred.

programme.title: Step Up Revolution
programme.desc: Newly arrived in Miami, young dancer Emily (Kathryn McCormick) dreams of becoming a professional. She soon meets and falls in love with Sean (Ryan Guzman), the leader of a dance crew called "the Mob." When a rich businessman's plans to develop the dancers' historic neighborhood threatens to displace thousands of people, Emily must join forces with Sean and the Mob to turn their performance art into protest art, even though doing so may place her dreams in jeopardy.

programme.title: Reign Over Me
programme.desc: Charlie Fineman (Adam Sandler), who lost his family in the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, still grieves over their deaths. He runs into his former college roommate, Alan Johnson (Don Cheadle), and the two rekindle their friendship. Alan himself is feeling the strain of family and professional responsibilities, and his renewed bond with Charlie gives both men the strength to carry on during a turning point in their lives.

programme.title: A Raisin in the Sun
programme.desc: Lena Younger (Phylicia Rashad) receives a settlement from her husband's life insurance policy and then must decide what to do with the money. She wants to move out of their apartment into a house in a more genteel neighborhood. Her eldest son, Walter (Sean Combs), aspires to be an entrepreneur. Daughter Beneatha (Sanaa Lathan) hopes to go to medical school. Though their aspirations collide, they try to find a way to retain their family's cohesion.

programme.title: Why Did I Get Married?
programme.desc: Eight married friends take their annual reunion vacation in the Colorado mountains. Revelations of infidelity involving one pair shatter the amicable mood, forcing the remaining friends to take a hard look at the strength of their own marriages. The couples grapple with issues of commitment, love, betrayal and forgiveness as they try to move on with their lives.

programme.title: Queenpins
programme.desc: A frustrated suburban housewife and her best friend hatch an illegal coupon-club scheme that scams millions from corporations and delivers deals to legions of fellow coupon clippers. Hot on their trail is an unlikely duo -- a hapless loss-prevention officer and a determined U.S. postal inspector -- both looking to end their criminal enterprise.

programme.title: Zola
programme.desc: Zola, a Detroit waitress, is seduced into a weekend of stripping in Florida for some quick cash -- but the trip becomes a sleepless 48-hour odyssey involving a nefarious friend, her pimp and her idiot boyfriend.

programme.title: American Honey
programme.desc: Star (Sasha Lane), an adolescent girl from a troubled home, runs away with a traveling sales crew that drives across the American Midwest selling subscriptions door-to-door. Finding her feet in this gang of teenagers, one of whom is Jake (Shia LaBeouf), she soon gets into the group's lifestyle of hard-partying nights, law-bending days and young love.

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: After the members of a team of scientists (Harold Ramis, Dan Aykroyd, Bill Murray) lose their cushy positions at a university in New York City, they decide to become "ghostbusters" to wage a high-tech battle with the supernatural for money. They stumble upon a gateway to another dimension, a doorway that will release evil upon the city. The Ghostbusters must now save New York from complete destruction.

programme.title: Ghostbusters II
programme.desc: After saving New York City from a ghost attack, the Ghostbusters -- a team of spirit exterminators -- is disbanded for demolishing parts of the city during the battle. But when Ghostbuster Peter Venkman (Bill Murray) learns that spirits have taken an interest in his son, the men launch a rogue ghost-chasing mission. The quest quickly goes awry, landing them in court. But when the ghosts turn on the judge, he issues an order allowing the Ghostbusters to get back to work.

The shopkeeper is reluctant to sell him the "mogwai" but sells it to him with the warning to never expose him to bright light, water, or to feed him after midnight. All of this happens and the result is a gang of gremlins that decide to tear up the town on Christmas Eve.

programme.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: Based on the beloved Roald Dahl tale, this comedic and fantastical film follows young Charlie Bucket (Freddie Highmore) and his Grandpa Joe (David Kelly) as they join a small group of contest winners who get to tour the magical and mysterious factory of eccentric candy maker Willy Wonka (Johnny Depp). Aided by his diminutive Oompa Loompa workers (Deep Roy), Wonka has a hidden motivation for the tour, one that he will reveal only after the children in the group show their true colors.

programme.title: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory

programme.title: WarGames
programme.desc: High school student David Lightman (Matthew Broderick) unwittingly hacks into a military supercomputer while searching for new video games. After starting a game of Global Thermonuclear War, Lightman leads the supercomputer to activate the nation's nuclear arsenal in response to his simulated threat as the Soviet Union. Once the clueless hacker comes to his senses, Lightman, with help from his girlfriend (Ally Sheedy), must find a way to alert the authorities to stop the onset of World War III.

programme.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
programme.desc: In this sequel set eleven years after "The Terminator," young John Connor (Edward Furlong), the key to civilization's victory over a future robot uprising, is the target of the shape-shifting T-1000 (Robert Patrick), a Terminator sent from the future to kill him. Another Terminator, the revamped T-800 (Arnold Schwarzenegger), has been sent back to protect the boy. As John and his mother (Linda Hamilton) go on the run with the T-800, the boy forms an unexpected bond with the robot.

programme.title: Mortal Kombat
programme.desc: Lord Rayden (Christopher Lambert) handpicks three martial artists -- federal agent Sonya Blade (Bridgette Wilson), Shaolin monk Lui Kang (Robin Shou) and action movie sensation Johnny Cage (Linden Ashby) -- and mentors them. After intense training, Rayden transports the trio to Outworld, the site of an inter-dimensional fighting tournament. There, the three humans must defeat the demonic warriors of the evil Shang Sung (Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa) -- or allow Sung to take over the Earth.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: With the imminent destruction of Krypton, their home planet, Jor-El (Russell Crowe) and his wife seek to preserve their race by sending their infant son to Earth. The child's spacecraft lands at the farm of Jonathan (Kevin Costner) and Martha (Diane Lane) Kent, who name him Clark and raise him as their own son. Though his extraordinary abilities have led to the adult Clark (Henry Cavill) living on the fringe of society, he finds he must become a hero to save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.desc: Mike Johnson and Joe have been hunting partners for longer than most people stay married. Through successful harvests and learning experience hunts.

programme.title: Pigman: The Series
programme.desc: Pig and Junie are lock and loaded in god's country. It's all mud, gators, hogs, and mayhem on this trip!

programme.title: Crossroads With The Burtons
programme.desc: Jeb and Ward watch an episode of 'Crossroads' with fans; Jeb provides insight on the future of his NASCAR career.

programme.title: The Bearded Buck
programme.desc: Jerry, Austin, and their good friend, Bob, travel to Utah on a bucket list hunt to chase mountain lions. But with tracking conditions going from bad to worse, they will need luck on their side in order to fill their tags.

programme.title: Last of A Breed
programme.desc: A look back at the best of this season.

programme.title: Savage Outdoors
programme.desc: It's the end of deer season for the guys at SOE hunts and they're taking advantage of a few days without clients to do some hunting for themselves.

programme.title: Backwoods Life
programme.desc: Michael Lee and Kevin Knighton are taking a look back at some of their most memorable whitetail bucks of the season and lessons learned along the way.

programme.title: RNT-V
programme.desc: Join John and Shawn as they talk about the history of the World Goose Calling Contest and the Chesapeake Bay area along with all of its waterfowling and decoy history.

programme.title: Ducks Unlimited TV
programme.desc: A mixed bag collection of the best moment of the challenging but rewarding 2020-2021 waterfowl season. An exciting recap with bonus footage.

programme.title: DoeNation Outdoors
programme.desc: Don't look away this week because if you do you will miss some nonstop big buck action from this past season.

programme.title: Small Town Hunting
programme.desc: March in Texas is a special time for turkey hunters. Lots of turkeys, lots of gobbling, and lots of tags means for a heck of a week to be in Texas.

programme.title: Wild Strongholds
programme.desc: Part 3: Northern Cameroon is home to Central and Western African savanna species. We investigate the threats facing these animals and what benefits hunting provides for the local communities and the ecosystem.

programme.title: Guns & Gear TV
programme.desc: Hit the hunt with the Savage Impulse straight-pull rifle. Plus, quiet shots with new suppressors from Silencer Central, Black Hills Ammunition's Gold in 6.5 Creedmoor, a new twist on a classic Smith & Wesson rifle, and EOTech's LPVO riflescope.

programme.title: Hardcore Pursuit
programme.desc: The boys meet up in Felch, Michigan to hunt local UP longbeards with special guest Ronnie Hardy of Hardy's Custom Calls.

programme.title: Livin' the Dream With Captain Jimmy Nelson
programme.sub-title: Cuberas and Roosters of Costa Rica
programme.desc: Capt. Jimmy and Luiza head to Crocodile Bay Resort in Costa Rica and after landing a giant cubera they target big roosters!

programme.title: Dropped
programme.desc: In the season premiere, brothers Chris and Casey Keefer are dropped in the wilderness of New Zealand, with virtually nothing; they must quickly adapt to their new environment or face life threatening consequences.

programme.title: Nordic Wild Hunter: Kristoffer Clausen
programme.desc: Kristoffer heads into the wilderness in his canoe looking for fresh signs of beaver. Beavers have a high level of body fat compared to most other game and this is a big advantage when trying to survive on the food available in the wilderness.

programme.title: BuckVentures
programme.desc: This week we are welcoming Aiden Rozier, a young man fighting cancer, into camp with hopes of getting him on his first deer.

programme.title: Trekin Outdoors
programme.desc: A challenging start for the boys in Colorado, however, they're left with an Elk and Moose ecounter that they will remember forever!

programme.title: MOJO TV

programme.title: Larry Smith Outdoors

programme.title: Two Conchs Sports Fishing TV

programme.title: Extreme Angler TV
programme.desc: Tactics for big smallmouth bass in clear water in Algoma Country.

programme.title: Steve's Outdoor Adventures

programme.title: Extreme Outer Limits

programme.title: American Airgunner

programme.title: Great Parks of Africa
programme.desc: Take a dip in iSimangaliso Wetland Park's unique mosaic of ecosystems. Explore grasslands, forests, swamps, lakes, beaches, and coral reefs, and see the incredibly diverse animal life its varied climatic zones support.

programme.title: Great Parks of Africa
programme.desc: Competition for resources is hot in the Great Karoo's semi-desert climate. Witness a young caracal, a small African cat, make his first kill after leaving his mother, and see how springboks, eagles, and zebras scratch out a living against all odds.

programme.title: Great Parks of Africa
programme.desc: Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park supports an array of species that have adapted creative survival strategies. Follow the park's ancient dry riverbeds and get a close-up look at how plants and animals tap into deep underground water sources to stay alive.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Meet six animal pairs who have developed unusual attachments. From a duck who overcame his fear of water thanks to a lake-loving dog to an orphaned deer who found friendship with a herd of cows, their bonds have surprising benefits.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: When in need, animals sometimes turn to other species for companionship. See how a U.S. turkey who escaped dinner pairs up with a rescue dog, tiny U.K. songbirds raise a cuckoo chick, and a lonely meerkat in Namibia becomes part of a mongoose family.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: The instinct to protect young ones is hard to suppress. Marvel at the way animals, both male and female, care for babies of other species. Meet a lonely rabbit who babysits lambs, and a little rescued rhino who finds encouragement from a playful dog.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Animals need companionship, just like humans, and these odd couples found it in species outside their own. Meet a miniature pig who befriends an outcast dog, and an orphaned baby kangaroo who shares a handmade pouch with a motherless little wombat.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Support animals for humans are common, but when they support other species, things get a little wild. Meet a troop of monkeys who invite three rescue cats into their home in a rescue centre, and a playful dog who cares for a rescued calf.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Rescue animals share a unique bond. Encounter these odd animal pals, including a bison who befriends a young calf, and an antelope who bonds with a young calf, as they team up to heal and sometimes return to the wild.

programme.title: Animal Empires
programme.desc: Raising the young is crucial for every species to survive. See how in some social circles, it takes a village to raise a family. In others, a single parent is all that stands between the vulnerability of youth and the threats of the wild.

programme.title: A Bee's Diary
programme.desc: In a beehive, tens of thousands of tiny animals work toward a common goal: the survival of the colony. But what is life like for an individual honeybee? A Bee's Diary tells that story.

programme.title: Ocean Parks
programme.desc: Take a journey deep into the South Caribbean Sea to explore the protected waters of the Bonaire National Marine Park, home to thriving reefs, endangered sea turtles, sprawling mangroves, and a plethora of marine life.

programme.title: Ocean Parks
programme.desc: In the Florida Keys, mangrove swamps serve as nurseries for fish and hunting grounds for endangered waterfowl, seagrass serves as food and shelter for fish and crustaceans, and coral reefs host diverse fish species and endangered sea turtles.

programme.title: Ocean Parks
programme.desc: Journey to a vast underwater rainforest of kelp that's home to hundreds of species of fish, forming the largest marine sanctuary in the U.S. Nearly destroyed by overfishing and pollution, this spectacular ecosystem is once again teeming with life.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: The sprawling primate family includes animals as different as monkeys, lemurs, and humans. Follow primate babies to see how they bond with their mothers, learn to socialize, and adapt to an ever-changing environment.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Witness veterinarian Dr. Amanda Salb save an elephant calf caught in a poacher's snare, racing time to treat the wound. Back at the base, an orphaned baby baboon meets his new family. A monitor lizard and duiker are returned to freedom in the wild.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Amanda puts a radio collar on one of the first cheetah cubs born in Malawi in twenty years and the team struggles to give a 4-meter python a physical. See a group of tourists deliver a rambunctious baby monkey they rescued from the pet trade.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Watch as the Lilongwe Wildlife team try to release two serval cats into the wild. One escapes and returns injured. Will their release be successful? A new baby vervet arrives in critical condition, and a giant owl flies to freedom.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join Amanda on a white knuckle bush-whacking adventure to rescue a waterbuck caught by a poacher's snare. Meanwhile, the centre's resident hyena is treated for flea bitten ears and Alma gets a mysterious late night monkey delivery.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: See Amanda and Sophie push boundaries to get a vervet monkey with a broken leg back into the wild, the team is challenged when collaring a four tonne elephant. Alma receives an orphaned, cat-like genet and an antisocial baboon rejoins a troop.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join the rescue as Amanda and Mandy try every trick in the book to help a snared hyena, a lion threatens a village, and the team's plan to release a troop of 13 monkeys is thwarted by last minute surgery and some crafty escape artists.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Head to the heart of Central Kalimantan, Borneo-home to one of the most unique schools in the world. There are 68 students in all, including class clown Valentino (who loves a short-cut) and class couple Darril and Liti (who have their first fight).

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Best buds Valentino, Madara and Utris are ready for the next stage of forest school. Baby Clarita is at long last reunited with her mother. And toddler Mema discovers a tasty treat inside a rotten log (it can happen!).

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Even orangutans have to watch what they eat. Find out if Beni can stick to a leafy green diet (and stop stealing food). See what kind of tasty treats Lanting can find while skipping class. And watch as Rebecca prepares to return to a truly wild life.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: There's watery fun with group two as they visit group three's flooded classroom. Ayu, Ruthie, and Kesi take a step closer to release. And the arrival of Alba-the world's rarest orangutan-creates a sensation at Orangutan Jungle School.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Now that albino orangutan Alba's here, how will her classmates react? Plus, take a tour of the nursery school, see how Beni deals with a big bully, and watch as a few feisty females find their place in a new hierarchy.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join Amanda on a white knuckle bush-whacking adventure to rescue a waterbuck caught by a poacher's snare. Meanwhile, the centre's resident hyena is treated for flea bitten ears and Alma gets a mysterious late night monkey delivery.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: See Amanda and Sophie push boundaries to get a vervet monkey with a broken leg back into the wild, the team is challenged when collaring a four tonne elephant. Alma receives an orphaned, cat-like genet and an antisocial baboon rejoins a troop.

programme.title: Ocean Parks
programme.desc: After decades of overfishing and tourist activity, the second-longest barrier reef in the world is in jeopardy. But ocean advocates have lined the reef with a series of protected areas dedicated to maintaining its feeding and spawning grounds.

programme.title: Ocean Parks
programme.desc: Hundreds of tiny islands south of the Bahamian capital of Nassau form a remote wonder that was almost lost to development in the 1950s. But in 1959, the Bahamian government established the first of 31 protected areas to preserve this pristine region.

programme.title: Wild Crusades
programme.desc: Hidden in the jungles of Sri Lanka is a charismatic monkey: the toque macaque. Each macaque is unique, from its facial features to social skills. With increasing human contact, see how the monkeys lives are being affected in unexpected ways.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted frog ponds. Get up close and personal with exoctic, colourful and poisonous frogs including the poison dart frog and green tree frog.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Follow an injured opossum into surgery, as the medical team realizes amputation may be the only way to save his badly injured toe. And meet some turtle hatchlings who seem ready for release when the team gets disappointing details about their size.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Meet a flock of cedar waxwings who have taken over the centre's aviary and are keeping the staff busy with endless demands for food. Then the rescue team works with the Ministry of Natural Resources to relocate a coyote that's too people-friendly.

programme.title: Extreme Africa
programme.desc: Every step up the mighty Drakensberg reveals new species who showcase attributes that enable them to endure their harsh mountain home. Meet the sun gazer, the intriguingly named suicide lizard, the iconic bearded vulture and travelling raptors.

programme.title: Wild Latin America
programme.desc: Travel deep into the Columbian rainforest, where it's mating season for one of the most clever monkey species in the world. Witness the most important time of year for male squirrel monkeys that have been bulking up to impress females for months.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Meet six animal pairs who have developed unusual attachments. From a duck who overcame his fear of water thanks to a lake-loving dog to an orphaned deer who found friendship with a herd of cows, their bonds have surprising benefits.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join the rescue as Amanda and Mandy try every trick in the book to help a snared hyena, a lion threatens a village, and the team's plan to release a troop of 13 monkeys is thwarted by last minute surgery and some crafty escape artists.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: In the early months of the year, the Earth's axial tilt brings the height of summer in some places and the depths of winter in others. See how life struggles to survive under these extreme conditions.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Travel around the globe to witness the atmospheric shifts that take place in March, from the wave of cherry blossoms that unfold across Japan to the final raft of green sea turtles that arrive on the Great Barrier Reef islands to lay eggs.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Watch summer unfold in the Northern Hemisphere, while regions close to the equator enter the wet season and Southern Africa goes dry, creating scarcity for some creatures and bounty for others.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Witness some of the planet's most dramatic natural shifts in July, from the Arctic ice sheets that come crashing down during the summer melt to the feeding frenzy when sockeye salmon reach the end of their journey in Alaska.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Travel around the world to see another seasonal change unfold. The Northern Hemisphere moves into autumn, while Australia witnesses a rebirth of life, and mating humpbacks fill the warming tropical seas of Tonga.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Witness some of the most incredible natural events in November, from the millions of Monarch butterflies that converge in Mexico's forests to the deep fog that shrouds the city of Dubai, signalling the start of winter.

programme.title: Extreme Africa
programme.desc: Every step up the mighty Drakensberg reveals new species who showcase attributes that enable them to endure their harsh mountain home. Meet the sun gazer, the intriguingly named suicide lizard, the iconic bearded vulture and travelling raptors.

programme.title: Wild Latin America
programme.desc: Travel deep into the Columbian rainforest, where it's mating season for one of the most clever monkey species in the world. Witness the most important time of year for male squirrel monkeys that have been bulking up to impress females for months.

programme.title: The Big Dry
programme.desc: Many species call Zambia's Luangwa Valley home, but it has one of the toughest dry seasons imaginable-no rain for seven months and extreme temperatures. Yet for some animals, the dry season means opportunity.

programme.title: The Big Dry
programme.desc: It's October in Zambia's Luangwa Valley-the hottest and harshest time of year. There has been no rain since April and desperate animals are drawn to the only remaining source of water in the valley: the dwindling Luangwa River.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Meet six animal pairs who have developed unusual attachments. From a duck who overcame his fear of water thanks to a lake-loving dog to an orphaned deer who found friendship with a herd of cows, their bonds have surprising benefits.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join the rescue as Amanda and Mandy try every trick in the book to help a snared hyena, a lion threatens a village, and the team's plan to release a troop of 13 monkeys is thwarted by last minute surgery and some crafty escape artists.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Leave the river behind and stalk the valley's grasslands. Explore territory that's home to a troop of baboons, a family of warthogs, and a solitary female leopard named Olimba. Check in with a nesting family of storks and fend off wild dogs at night.

programme.title: Zambia Untamed
programme.desc: In the Luangwa Valley, a grove of Ebony trees is home to a baboon troop. One youngster, Makupa, is the target of bullying because he's been born with white hair. Can his mother find support and elude the valley's lurking dangers to keep him safe?

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: Half an hour of uninterrupted views of giraffes and zebras as they eat and play.

programme.title: Great Lakes Wild
programme.desc: Since the 1900's, this uninhabited island in Lake Superior has been a constant battleground between moose and wolves. Join a band of volunteers as they scour the island for moose bones, trying to piece together population numbers after a long winter.

programme.title: Great Lakes Wild
programme.desc: As far as invasive species go, Asian carp are some of the nastiest around. See how they've made their way up America's waterways by eating voraciously, breeding quickly, and decimating native fish populations.

programme.title: Extreme Africa
programme.desc: Tanzania's Lake Manyara National Park boasts a number of diverse habitats. From woodland savannas to grassy marshes, visit a region that is a special part of the east African ecosystem and provides a wealth of resources to its wildlife.

programme.desc: Gravitational waves are helping scientists explore the cosmos in revolutionary, new ways, and the discoveries they make are revealing the universe's greatest mysteries.
